document.docAuthor: Costa, Erika L. S. & Ruiz, Gustavo R. S.
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of Scopocira Simon, 1900 (Araneae: Salticidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic revision of Scopocira Simon, 1900 (Araneae: Salticidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Salticus melanops
Taczanowski, 1871
: 117
(Female holotype from Rio Uassá, currently Amapá, Brazil (not French Guiana ), R. Jelski, deposited in Polska Akademia Nauk, lost, not examined).

Scopocira melanops :
Galiano, 1969
: 145
; World Spider Catalog, 2014 .

subSubSection.paragraph: Note. Although we were not able to locate the holotype of this species in the PAN collection, Cristina Scioscia has kindly sent us the unpublished illustrations and descriptions of this type made by Galiano. Based on the illustration of the epigyne, we were able to identify this species.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 162–167.
S. kunai
sp. nov. 162 male, dorsal view; 163 left male palp, ventral view; 164 same, retrolateral view; 165 female, dorsal view; 166 epigyne, ventral view; 167 same, cleared, dorsal view. Scale bar=1 mm (162, 165); 0.25 mm (163–164, 166–167).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Males of
S. melanops
(see
Fig. 100
) are similar to those of
S. pterodactyla
(
Fig. 102
) by the embolus folded in angle of about 90 º with the palp axis, but can be distinguished by the paraembolic projection, stout and low in this species (thin and longer in
S. pterodactyla
). Females are recognized by the reduced spermathecae (Fig. 173 ).

Description. Male ( IBSP
170246
).
Total length: 4.54 . Carapace orange, 2.24 long, 1.58 wide, 1.06 high (Fig. 168 ). Ocular quadrangle 1.21 long. Anterior eye row 1.15 wide and posterior 1.07 wide. Palp yellow (Figs 169‒170 ); RvTA reduced and ITA small and granulated; embolus short, pointing prolaterally. Legs 1423 , yellow (I orange), only I and IV with dark longitudinal stripes. Length of femur: I 2.18 , II 1.47 , III 1.47 , IV 1.80 ; patella + tibia: I 2.92 , II 1.73 , III 1.57 , IV 2.16 ; metatarsus + tarsus: I 2.02 , II 1.50 , III 1.62 , IV 2.10 . Spination on ventral tibia I: 2 - 0-2 - 2 . Abdomen cream-colored, dorsally with a median pair of tufts of white scales on the laterals and a transverse brown stripe on posterior part (Fig. 168 ); ventrally cream-colored, with a brown spot close to spinnerets.

Female (ex-IBSP 115999 ).
Total length: 3.78 . Carapace orange, 1.77 long, 1.05 wide, 0.71 high (Fig. 171 ). Ocular quadrangle 0.94 long. Anterior eye row 0.94 wide and posterior 0.89 wide. Legs 4132 , yellow. Length of femur: I 1.14 , II 0.92 , III 0.93 , IV 1.23 ; patella + tibia: I 1.48 , II 1.07 , III 1.07 , IV 1.43 ; metatarsus + tarsus: I 1.09 , II 0.92 , III 1.07 , IV 1.41 . Spination as in male. Abdomen as in male, except for the anterior dark portion (Fig. 171 ). Epigyne as in Figs 172‒173 .
